

```{r, BimodalFaithfulHistoChangeBins, fig.align="center", fig.width=5.25, fig.height =1.75, fig.cap="Histograms of the Old Faithful data; changing the bins can change the impression of the distribution. Left: sensible bins; centre: poor bin choice; right: too few bins.", out.width='100%'}
par( mfrow = c(1, 3),
     mar = c(5.15, 5.1, 2.55, 1.5) + 0.1) 

hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Sensible bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in mins)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     xlim = c(40, 100),
     las = 2,
     breaks = 12,
     axes = FALSE,
     col = plot.colour)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 2)
axis(side = 1,
     cex = 0.9,
     las = 2,
     at = seq(40, 100, by = 20))

hist(faithful$waiting,
     breaks = seq(36, 1110, by = 14),
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Poor bin choice",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in mins)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     xlim = c(35, 110),
     las = 2,
     #breaks = 50,
     axes = FALSE,
     col = plot.colour)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 2)
axis(side = 1,
     cex = 0.9,
     las = 2,
     at = seq(40, 100, by = 20))

hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Too few bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in mins)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     xlim = c(40, 100),
     las = 2,
     breaks = 3,
     axes = FALSE,
     col = plot.colour)
axis(side = 2,
